PreparerFirmName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: TYLER SIMMS & ST SAUVEUR CPA PC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TAKING INSPIRATION FROM OUR MOTTO, PROCTOR ACADEMY CREATES A DIVERSE LEARNING AND LIVING COMMUNITY: ONE THAT VALUES THE INDIVIDUAL AND RECOGNIZES THE POTENTIAL OF EACH MEMBER TO STRETCH BEYOND WHAT HAD BEEN THOUGHT POSSIBLE. BALANCING ACADEMIC RIGOR, STRUCTURE, AND SUPPORT WITH THE FREEDOM FOR STUDENTS TO EXPLORE, CREATE AND DEFINE THEMSELVES, PROCTOR ENCOURAGES STUDENTS TO ACHIEVE THEIR OPTIMAL GROWTH. A DEEP COMMITMENT TO A LEARNING SKILLS PROGRAM AND A STRONG EMPHASIS ON EXPERIMENTAL LEARNING IS INTERWOVEN THROUGHOUT PROCTOR'S ACADEMIC, ATHLETIC, ARTISTIC, AND ENVIRONMENTALLY CONSCIOUS PROGRAMS BOTH ON AND OFF CAMPUS. PROCTOR STUDENTS GRADUATE UNDERSTANDING THE VALUES OF HONESTY, COMPASSION, RESPECT, AND RESONSIBILTY, PROCEEDING WITH CONFIDENCE AND WITH STRATEGIES TO BECOME LIFE-LONG LEARNERS AND THOUGHTFUL CONTRIBUTORS TO THEIR COMMUNITIES.

IRS990.Desc: EDUCATING 360 HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS TAUGHT BY 90 FACULTY AND SPECIALISTS IN 180 SCHOOL DAYS AND IN 3 TRIMESTERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TO PROVIDE A PREDICTABLE STREAM OF FUNDING FOR THE PROGRAMS SUPPORTED BY THE ENDOWMENT WHILE SEEKING TO MAINTAIN THE PURCHASING POWER OF THE ENDOWMENT ASSETS.

THE SCHOOL IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE U.S. INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, EXCEPT WITH REGARD TO UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME, WHICH IS TAXED AT CORPORATE INCOME TAX RATES. ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION SUBTOPIC 740-10, ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES, ADDRESSES THE ACCOUNTING UNCERTAINTY OF INCOME TAXES RECOGNIZED IN AN ENTERPRISE'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND PRESCRIBES A THRESHOLD OF "MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT" FOR RECOGNITION AND DERECOGNITION OF TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN. SUBTOPIC 740-10 ALSO PROVIDES GUIDANCE ON MEASUREMENT CLASSIFICATION, INTEREST AND PENALTIES AND DISCLOSURE. THE SCHOOL HAS DETERMINED THAT THE PROVISIONS OF SUBTOPIC 740-10 DO NOT HAVE A MATERIAL EFFECT ON THE SCHOOL'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE SCHOOL BELIEVES IT IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATIONS FOR YEARS PRIOR TO 2012
PLEDGE VALUATION ALLOWANCE 13,000. SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENT VALUATION ALLOWANCE -43,867.
FINANCIAL AID 3,533,033. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES -12,587. POST-RETIREMENT HEALTH BENEFIT OBLIGATION CHANGES -55,305. RENTAL EXPENSES -13,305. BOOKSTORE COST OF SALES -322,937.
BOOKSTORE COST OF SALES 322,937. RENTAL EXPENSES 13,305. FUNDRAISING EVENT EXPENSES 12,587.
FINANCIAL AID 3,533,033. PLEDGE VALUATION ALLOWANCE -13,000. SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENT VALUATION ALLOWANCE 43,867.
PROCTOR ACADEMY PUBLICIZES ITS NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY IN THE CONCORD MONITOR NEWSPAPER ANNUALLY IN SEPTEMBER. THE POLICY IS PUBLICIZED ON THE PROCTOR ACADEMY'S WEBSITE.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER FINANCIAL AID FOR STUDENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID MAINTAINS THE RECORDS, AND THE CHIEF FINANCIAL & OPERATING OFFICER CONFIRMS THE TOTAL FINANCIAL AID TO THE BUDGETED AMOUNT.

ANNUALLY, THE CHAIR OF THE FINANCE COMMITTEE, PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD AND THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE (ACTING IN ITS CAPACITY AS THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE) USE THE INDEPENDENT SCHOOL ASSOCIATION OF NORTHERN NEW ENGLAND (ISANNE) PAY RATES, INFORMATION FROM FORM 990'S AND AN INTERNALLY PREPARED COMPENSATION STUDY TO DETERMINE AND APPROVE THE HEAD OF SCHOOL'S COMPENSATION. AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT AS HEAD OF SCHOOL AND IN ORDER TO FULFILL RESPONSIBILITIES AS HEAD OF SCHOOL, AND FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF THE SCHOOL THE HEAD OF SCHOOL WILL BE PROVIDED WITH HOUSING ON THE MAIN CAMPUS OF THE SCHOOL, WHICH INCLUDES PAYMENT OF ALL UTILITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROCTOR HAS AN ACCOUNT AT MORGAN STANLEY AND ALL STOCK GIFTS ARE IMMEDIATELY LIQUIDATED AND TRANSFERRED TO THE SCHOOL'S BANK ACCOUNT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE, AND THE FINANCE COMMITTEE INCLUDING THE PRESIDENT AND THE HEAD OF SCHOOL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS ARE ASKED ANNUALLY TO REPORT ON ANY CONFLICTS OF INTERESTS THAT THEY MAY HAVE. THAT INFORMATION IS ANNOUNCED PUBLICLY TO THE REST OF THE BOARD AND POSTED INTO THE NEWSPAPER.
